Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the impact of walls on reducing crime rates in El Paso.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that El Paso was never one of the most dangerous cities in the country and that there was no significant drop in crime rates after the construction of a wall.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or data to support the assertion that walls are effective in reducing crime.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the difference in murder rates between Juarez and El Paso is solely due to the presence of a wall, without considering other factors.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to acknowledge alternative explanations for the difference in crime rates between Juarez and El Paso, such as differences in law enforcement strategies or socio-economic factors.
